publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1898 Lord James Douglas-Hamilton: Proposed Cuts to The Scottish Regiments—That the Parliament believes that the proposed substantial cuts to the size of both the regular army and the Territorial Army will undermine the efficiency and morale of the British armed forces, damage our military capability, and threaten the future of Scotland’s historic frontline regiments and calls upon the Her Majesty's Government to reject this irresponsible course of action. Supported by: David McLetchie*, Ben Wallace*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*, Alex Fergusson*, David Mundell*, Mr Keith Harding*
S1M-1898 Proposed Cuts to The Scottish Regiments (lodged on 2 May 2001) Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh*, John Scott*, Phil Gallie*, Bill Aitken*, Mr Jamie Stone*

S1M-1898 Lord James Douglas-Hamilton: Proposed Cuts to The Scottish Regiments—That the Parliament believes that the proposed substantial cuts to the size of both the regular army and the Territorial Army will undermine the efficiency and morale of the British armed forces, damage our military capability, and threaten the future of Scotland’s historic frontline regiments and calls upon the Her Majesty's Government to reject this irresponsible course of action. Supported by: David McLetchie, Ben Wallace, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mr Keith Harding, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, John Scott, Phil Gallie, Bill Aitken, Mr Jamie Stone
S1M-1898 Proposed Cuts to The Scottish Regiments (lodged on 2 May 2001) Donald Gorrie*, Nick Johnston*
S1M-1898 Proposed Cuts to The Scottish Regiments (lodged on 2 May 2001) Nora Radcliffe*, Mr Brian Monteith*, Robert Brown*
S1M-1898 Proposed Cuts to The Scottish Regiments (lodged on 2 May 2001) Mary Scanlon*

S1M-1898 Lord James Douglas-Hamilton: Proposed Cuts to The Scottish Regiments—That the Parliament believes that the proposed substantial cuts to the size of both the regular army and the Territorial Army will undermine the efficiency and morale of the British armed forces, damage our military capability, and threaten the future of Scotland’s historic frontline regiments and calls upon the Her Majesty's Government to reject this irresponsible course of action. Supported by: David McLetchie, Ben Wallace, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Alex Fergusson, David Mundell, Mr Keith Harding, Mrs Lyndsay McIntosh, John Scott, Phil Gallie, Bill Aitken, Mr Jamie Stone, Donald Gorrie, Nick Johnston, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Brian Monteith, Robert Brown, Mary Scanlon
